content: I do not have the ability to watch or analyse movies. however, i can give an example of a thriller novel that had excellent pacing - "the silence of the lambs" by thomas harris. the book's pacing was terrific, with each chapter building up suspense, revealing critical information, and maintaining the reader's interest throughout the story. the author masterfully balanced the slow, tension-building scenes with the fast-paced action scenes, creating an engaging and thrilling reading experience.
